csv_inventory.description: Master list of players with core identifiers and active status.
csv_inventory.grain: one row per player (global NBA player_id)

columns.name: id
columns.notes: Primary player identifier used across many sources; aligns with NBA.com-style person_id.

columns.name: is_active
columns.notes: 0/1 flag; maps to active status in canonical players dimension.

csv_inventory.description: Extended biographical and identifier info for historical and current players.
csv_inventory.grain: one row per historical player identity (per slug)

foreign_key_candidates.notes: Text slug used to link to other datasets that follow Basketball-Reference-style slugs.

columns.name: slug
columns.notes: Primary key for this table; candidate cross-source key for historical player mappings.

csv_inventory.description: Detailed per-player bio and roster metadata, aligned with NBA.com commonplayerinfo.
csv_inventory.grain: one row per player_id (modern/NBA data-centric view)

foreign_key_candidates.notes: Current/last team; nullable/0 when not on a team.

columns.name: player_slug
columns.notes: Slug used in URLs; mapping key.

csv_inventory.description: Per-player per-season roster and basic info (team, league, position).
csv_inventory.grain: one row per player-season-team stint (with some TOT rows aggregated)

foreign_key_candidates.notes: Links season rows to player dimension.

columns.name: seas_id
columns.notes: Unique surrogate key for player-season row.

csv_inventory.description: Career summary per player (span and HOF flag).
csv_inventory.grain: one row per player (career summary context)

csv_inventory.description: Master list of modern NBA team franchises.
csv_inventory.grain: one row per current franchise

columns.name: id
columns.notes: Franchise/team id; primary key; used across other tables.

columns.name: abbreviation
columns.notes: Short code; aligns with common abbreviations.

columns.name: year_founded
columns.notes: First season in NBA/BAA context; float due to source but logically int.

csv_inventory.description: Franchise location/name history by team_id.
csv_inventory.grain: one row per team_id and historical city/nickname span

foreign_key_candidates.notes: Links historical names to team dimension.

columns.name: year_founded
columns.notes: Start year of this identity span.

columns.name: year_active_till
columns.notes: End year of this identity span.

csv_inventory.description: Template for per-season team summary info (currently only header).

columns.notes: Likely whether game is in play-by-play/wh context; ambiguous.

columns.notes: Team id for the row; naming inconsistent with content for older rows; treat as team_id.

columns.notes: Points by quarter and OT; many columns.

additional_files_note: Filenames present in directory listing but whose contents were not fully shown above (e.g., draft_combine_stats.csv, draft_history.csv beyond sample, officials.csv, teamstatsper100poss.csv, opponentstatsper100poss for all rows, playerplaybyplay.csv, playershooting.csv, game_info.csv, teamsummaries.csv, team_details for all teams) follow analogous patterns:
additional_files_patterns: draft_*: entity_mapping ['draft', 'players'], grain one row per drafted player/measurement, primary keys based on person_id + season or similar, FKs to players and teams.
playerplaybyplay.csv: entity_mapping ['pbp_events', 'players'], grain per player-season team on/off splits.
playershooting.csv: entity_mapping ['players', 'advanced_metrics'], grain per player-season shooting splits.
teamstatsper100poss.csv: entity_mapping ['teams', 'advanced_metrics'], grain per team-season per-100 metrics.
teamsummaries.csv / game_info.csv / officials.csv: mapping/metadata entities for games/teams/officials.
notes: This inventory is based strictly on the CSV contents provided or implied; some files listed (e.g., draft_combine_stats.csv, game_info.csv, officials.csv, playershooting.csv, playerplaybyplay.csv, teamstatsper100poss.csv, teamsummaries.csv, team_info_common.csv body) were not fully visible in the excerpts. Their mappings are inferred from standard public schemas and should be verified in Phase 1 by inspecting full headers.

Player identifiers: player.csv.id, common_player_info.csv.person_id, and playerawardshares/playerseasoninfo/playercareerinfo player_id fields appear to represent the same logical player key (NBA.com person_id). A unified players dimension should treat this as the canonical numeric key, with playerdirectory.slug and other text fields as secondary natural keys.

Team identifiers: team.csv.id is the canonical team key. Historical teams in game/line_score/other_stats use legacy ids (e.g., 1610610035 for Huskies); these should be modeled either in the same teams dimension with historical rows or a separate historical_teams dimension. teamabbrev.csv and team_history.csv provide bridging between names/abbreviations and ids.

Game identifiers: game_id is consistently used across game.csv, game_summary.csv, line_score.csv, play_by_play.csv, other_stats.csv, inactive_players.csv. The canonical games entity should key on game_id, with date, season, and home/away teams drawn from game_summary/game.csv.

Box score grain: game.csv stores both home and away stats in a single row (wide format). For a normalized schema, it should be refactored into a team-game fact table (one row per game_id+team_id), aligning with line_score and other_stats, which are effectively at that grain despite wide naming.

Per-player season stats (playerpergame, playertotals, per36minutes, per100poss, advanced) all appear to share seas_id as a surrogate key tying a player-season-team row across tables. This is a strong candidate for a canonical player_season_team fact grain; Phase 1 should confirm uniqueness and consistent usage of seas_id.

Award tables (playerawardshares, endofseasonteams, endofseasonteams_voting, all_starselections) mix text names and numeric ids. For robustness and to avoid name collisions, Phase 1 should standardize on numeric player_id and, where applicable, seas_id when joining to players and season stats.

Opponent stats tables (opponenttotals, opponentstatspergame, opponentstatsper100poss) represent opponent performance against each team; they logically belong in the same team-season metrics mart as teamtotals/teamstatspergame/teamstatsper100poss and share keys.
Several float-typed year fields (e.g., year_founded, from_year/to_year) are semantically integers; Phase 1 should normalize these to integer types in PostgreSQL.

Historical abbreviations and legacy team_ids (e.g., PIT, HUS, CHS, etc.) require a clear mapping policy to avoid collisions with modern franchises; architects should decide whether to treat them as separate team entities or as historical states of a franchise.
